ArticleTitle.sentence: The class II trans-activator CIITA interacts with the TBP-associated factor TAFII32.

event.clue: The class II trans-activator CIITA interacts with the TBP-associated factor TAFII32.

AbstractText.sentence: The class II trans- activator (CIITA) is the main transcriptional co-activator for the expression of MHC class II proteins.

event.clue: The class II trans- activator (CIITA) is the main transcriptional co-activator for the expression of MHC class II proteins.

AbstractText.sentence: Its N-terminal 125 amino acids function as an independent transcriptional activation domain.

event.clue: Its N-terminal 125 amino acids function as an independent transcriptional activation domain.

AbstractText.sentence: Analyses of the primary amino acid sequence of the activation domain predict the presence of three alpha-helices, each with a high proportion of acidic residues.
Using site-directed mutagenesis, we found that two of these predicted alpha-helices are required for full transcriptional activation by CIITA.

event.clue: Using site-directed mutagenesis, we found that two of these predicted alpha-helices are required for full transcriptional activation by CIITA.
Using site-directed mutagenesis, we found that two of these predicted alpha-helices are required for full transcriptional activation by CIITA.

AbstractText.sentence: Moreover, a CIITA protein in which both functional alpha-helices have been deleted displays a dominant negative phenotype.

event.clue: Moreover, a CIITA protein in which both functional alpha-helices have been deleted displays a dominant negative phenotype.
Moreover, a CIITA protein in which both functional alpha-helices have been deleted displays a dominant negative phenotype.

AbstractText.sentence: This activation domain of CIITA interacts with the 32 kDa subunit of the general transcription complex TFIID, TAFII32.

event.clue: This activation domain of CIITA interacts with the 32 kDa subunit of the general transcription complex TFIID, TAFII32.

AbstractText.sentence: Decreased transcriptional activation by N-terminal deletions of CIITA is correlated directly with their reduced binding to TAFII32.

event.clue: Decreased transcriptional activation by N-terminal deletions of CIITA is correlated directly with their reduced binding to TAFII32.
Decreased transcriptional activation by N-terminal deletions of CIITA is correlated directly with their reduced binding to TAFII32.

AbstractText.sentence: We conclude that interactions between TAFII32 and CIITA are responsible for activation of class II genes.

event.clue: We conclude that interactions between TAFII32 and CIITA are responsible for activation of class II genes.
